items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - November 2024

items.summary: Get started with the design system and a how-to demo of template creation and a prototyping approach.

items.deck: This month, we get the inside story on the Center for Plain Language’s Federal Report Card.
items.summary: David Lipscomb from the Center for PL will review the results of this year’s Federal Plain Language Report Card and answer questions.

items.title: Successful Strategies for Telework and Hybrid Work Environments
items.deck: This workshop will include expert presentations and discussions around succeeding at working, managing, supervising, hiring, collaborating, and communication in remote and hybrid environments.
items.summary: Learn from and share with other federal colleagues from across the government strategies for succeeding at working, managing, supervising, collaborating, communicating, and more.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call: October 2021
items.summary: This month's topic: Community, Connection & Contribution. How can our community help teams solve problems together?

items.title: How To Best Connect With Your Spanish-speaking Audience During an Emergency
items.summary: The Multilingual Community of Practice is hosting a panel to share some successful social media strategies that you can use to connect with your Spanish-speaking audience during emergencies.

items.title: 2021 Federal Plain Language Summit
items.deck: This summit will showcase Plain Language Community of Practice members’ experiences and successes in plain language: their projects, their efforts, their edits.
items.summary: On 9/21/21, PLAIN's Fourth Federal PL Summit showcases federal employees’ plain language projects. Topics include COVID-19 agency responses, accessibility, user experience, and career enhancement.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - September 2021
items.summary: Let's peer into the crystal ball and look into the future of USWDS.

items.title: FedRAMP & DAP Case Study Part 2: Reporting and Decision-Making
items.deck: See how the FedRAMP team assessed their analytics objectives and key performance indicators (KPIs) prior to the launch of their redesigned site, fedramp.gov.
items.summary: In this second part of our analytics case study series, we'll address how to pull reporting and conduct analysis through the lens of your analytics strategy.

items.title: SocialGov Summer Sessions 2021
items.summary: If you're a federal employee, join us to learn about both intellectual property (8/25) and rules of conduct (8/26) in your agency’s social media.

items.title: FedRAMP & DAP Case Study Part 1: Assessing Analytics Strategy
items.deck: See how the FedRAMP team assessed their analytics objectives and key performance indicators (KPIs) prior to the launch of a redesigned site.
items.summary: In this two-part Analytics Case Study, we'll speak with the GSA’s FedRAMP team about their analytics strategy, data collection, reporting, and subsequent decision-making for a new site launch.

items.title: Digital Meets Culture: Getting Your Culture in Line With Your Digital Strategy
items.summary: Join Digital.gov’s Web Managers Community as they host a discussion with panelists from the Lab at OPM, National Institutes of Health, Navy Bureau of Medicine and Surgery, and Presidential Innovation Fellows. The panel will discuss how to align culture and digital strategy to build better digital services.

items.title: Using Plain Language To Tell Our Stories
items.deck: Use templates to craft simple stories with purpose.
items.summary: Learn how to tell a story and figure out what role plain language plays in storytelling.

items.title: Digital Strategy at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue: Q&A with Rob Flaherty, White House Director of Digital Strategy
items.deck: An inside look at how the White House is thinking about digital strategy in the new normal.
items.summary: Join us for a conversation with Robert Flaherty, a digital native leading digital strategy at the White House.

items.title: 2021 User Experience Summit
items.summary: A 3-day remote summit covering User Experience (UX) management in the government.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - June 2021
items.summary: In this month’s session, we’ll unpack the new pagination component—what design problem it solves, how it came to be, what the U.S. Web Design System team did to build it, and what you and your teams can do with it.

items.title: Plain Language Webinar: Using Words to Build Better Digital Experiences
items.summary: Words make digital experiences human-centered, and require just as much thought as the branding and code. As federal agencies strive to use human-centered design, they need to remember that words and design work together. See how interfaces rely on language, and how your writing can make or break an experience. Learn principles for UX writing that anyone who works on digital products can apply to their own work.

items.title: Challenge and Prize Community Spotlight Chat with the Small Business Administration
items.summary: A discussion of lessons learned from implementing the Lab-to-Market (L2M) Inclusive Innovation Ecosystem prize competition with members of the prize planning committee, including the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy (OSTP), the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA), and the Science and Technology Policy Institute (STPI)-- one of three federally funded research and development centers of the Institute for Defense Analyses (IDA), a non-profit corporation that assists the federal government in addressing national security issues.

items.title: Accessible Digital Content: Tips and Tricks
items.summary: This webinar will present and demonstrate tips and tricks to address several common accessibility errors and issues that occur during digital content creation.

items.title: USWDS & Accessibility: Creating More Inclusive Federal Websites
items.deck: It’s Global Accessibility Awareness Day — join us as we unpack how we “do” accessibility as a top product priority.
items.summary: How does USWDS address accessibility? Join us as we share tips and tools for addressing accessibility throughout the lifecycle!

items.title: Positioning Yourself as a Plain Language Editor
items.summary: Learn how to brand yourself as a plain language expert and get the credit at work that you deserve!

items.title: Deep Fakes and Social Media
items.deck: Learn about the threat of deep fake technology on social media, and how to prepare your agency if you are targeted.
items.summary: Deep fakes are an emerging threat that can disrupt agencies’ communication efforts and federal agencies should be prepared. Learn about deep fakes on social media, and how federal agencies can plan to combat a deep fake if they are targeted.

items.title: Federal Developmental Opportunities Workshop
items.deck: Find out about developmental opportunities available for federal government employees.
items.summary: The Federal Leadership and Professional Development Seminar Series (FLPDSS) is hosting a cross-agency workshop focusing on developmental opportunities for federal employees.
items.host: Federal Leadership and Professional Development Community of Practice

items.title: Social Media Spring Session 2021
items.summary: Join the SocialGov Community of Practice for the latest updates on social media topics including advertising campaigns, content archiving, and podcasting.

items.title: Challenge and Prize Spotlight Chat with National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
items.deck: Building a legal framework for challenges and prize competitions at NIST
items.summary: Hear from NIST Innovation and Legal teams on the benefits of engaging legal counsel and establishing a legal framework for challenges and prize competitions in an agency.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - April 2021
items.summary: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as they answer the crucial question, “Why use the design system?”

items.title: How Testing Your Documents Can Improve Plain Language Compliance
items.deck: Come work with Dr. Ginny Redish and learn three techniques for quick, easy ways to test documents’ usability.
items.summary: Usability testing isn’t only for websites. Come work with Dr. Ginny Redish and try out three techniques for quick and easy ways to test the usability of your documents.

items.title: Artificial Intelligence for Homeland Security: Developing the Strategy
items.deck: If you are a federal employee, join us as the Department of Homeland Security presents their Department-wide AI Strategy.
items.summary: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) will present the work that led to the creation of the DHS AI Strategy to interagency partners.

items.title: Tag Managers Part 2: Configuration Framework
items.deck: Join the Data Analytics Team as they Provide a Practical Framework for using Google Tag Manager.
items.summary: This session will help DAP users configure and use their tag manager, to augment their reporting on more advanced interactions with their websites.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - March 2021
items.summary: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as we look at what’s in USWDS 2.11.0, our latest release.

items.title: Plain Language: Accessibility for Content
items.deck: Learn what the plain language and accessibility communities share: opportunities to help people get and understand information. Find out what you can do to help.
items.summary: Come join us  as we focus on concerns and opportunities shared by the Section 508 and plain language communities in Government!

items.title: Get your Idea Funded Through GSA's 10x Program
items.deck: Calling all federal employees: Learn how to turn your technology ideas into real projects.
items.summary: The purpose of the event is to raise awareness about 10x’s newest round of idea selections. We want attendees to learn about 10x, understand what it takes to submit, and feel empowered to submit.

items.title: Tag Managers Part 1: The Data Layer
items.deck: Learn what the tag manager data layer is and how you can utilize it.
items.summary: This session will help the audience expand analysis capabilities by using the tag manager data layer!

items.title: How Chatbots Can Improve Customer Experience
items.deck: Chatbots are a must-have in our customer experience strategy.
items.summary: Come see how various agencies have successfully deployed chatbots/AI to interact with the public and foster collaboration between teams!
items.host: Web Content Managers Community of Practice

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - February 2021
items.summary: Learn what's next for the U.S. Web Design System and our 2021 Roadmap—what we're planning to do this year, and why we're planning to do it.

items.title: Virtual Teaching: Plain Language
items.deck: Come and learn how to keep students engaged and focused during an online class.
items.summary: We’ve all had to learn new modes of presenting and communicating now that we’re teleworking full-time and depend on online broadcast technology. But how can you engage students and teach a class while sitting in front of a laptop camera? Join Wendy Wagner-Smith from the Small Business Administration and find out!

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - January 2021
items.summary: Learn how journey maps and service blueprints help teams better understand how people really use our sites and services to do what they need to do.

items.title: 2020 Federal Report Card Briefing
items.deck: David Lipscomb will review the results of the 2020 Federal Report Card
items.summary: David Lipscomb will review, The Annual Federal Report Card, which is a snapshot of how well the federal government is following the 2010 Plain Writing Act.

items.title: How To Navigate Challenges To Successfully A/B Test Your Emails
items.deck: How do you understand what resonates with users when sending out an email? Answer: A/B test it and find out!
items.summary: In this talk, we will provide better understanding of how CFPB conducts email A/B testing, see examples of email A/B tests, and discuss lessons learned.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - December 2020
items.deck: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as we look at what’s in our latest release: USWDS 2.10.0!
items.summary: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as we look at what's in our latest release: USWDS 2.10.0!

items.title: Federal Social Media Week 2020!
items.summary: 2020 has been an unprecedented year for challenges and opportunities in social media. SocialGov’s Federal Social Media Week 2020 will bring you some interesting perspectives on how to keep social media moving and successful for 2021.

items.title: Practical Tips for Accessible Content and Multilingual Websites
items.summary: In this talk, we'll focus on content creation and how accessibility supports multilingual work.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - November 2020
items.summary: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, to hear about what's next for the design system as we come to the end of 2020.

items.title: Customer Experience & Continuous Improvement: The USPS Digital Approach
items.summary: This presentation lays out USPS.com’s continuous improvement approach and how it combines analytics and customer feedback with iterative heuristic reviews, design, and usability testing to monitor, improve, and evolve the USPS.com CX.

items.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Panel Discussion #4: Veterans Day
items.summary: Panelists will discuss the challenges of transitioning and the benefits of transitioning from military to civilian service in the IT field.

items.title: Overview of NIST Initiatives on Artificial Intelligence Standards, Principles, and Critical AI Issues
items.deck: In this webinar, experts from the National Institute of Standards and Technology provide an overview of their key artificial intelligence initiatives including responsible, trustworthy, and explainable AI.
items.summary: In this webinar, experts from the National Institute of Standards and Technology provide an overview of their key artificial intelligence initiatives including responsible, trustworthy, and explainable AI.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 15 — 10x: Transforming Technology Through Agile Investments
items.summary: In this webinar, we will discuss GSA’s incremental investment program, 10x, which is modeled after modern venture capital best practices and start up studios.

items.title: 2020 Federal Plain Language Summit
items.summary: Join us for discussion from government and private-sector leaders on how to advance plain language in government communications. Hear lessons learned and victories of every size.

items.title: Analytics Case Study Part 3: Action
items.deck: How to take action using the analysis and insights you created using DAP and Google Analytics.
items.summary: In this webinar, we'll address how to use the analysis and insights you created using DAP Google Analytics, to take action.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - October 2020
items.deck: Deceptive design patterns—also known as “Dark Patterns”
items.summary: In this talk, we will uncover some of these tricks, and show what we all can do to assure that deceptive design patterns stay out of the sites we build.

items.title: Federal Source Code Summit: Towards a Source Code Community
items.summary: This summit brings together the federal community to share success stories and best practices for utilizing federal source code and open source software, and examine the implementation of the Federal Source Code policy.

items.title: Analytics Case Study Part 2: Analysis
items.deck: How to pull reporting and conduct analysis through the lens of your analytics strategy.
items.summary: In this workshop, we'll address how to pull reporting and conduct analysis through the lens of your analytics strategy.

items.title: A Fresh Start With DevOps - Maybe
items.summary: When legacy is used to define systems less than five years old, an agency can still encounter DevOps adoption challenges where you least expect them.

items.title: Operating Cloud Services Efficiently with Business-Driven IT
items.summary: Program managers, IT acquisitions leads, and business-minded IT professionals will receive in-depth guidance to improve cloud efficiency, optimization, and effective cost controls.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - September 2020
items.deck: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the three new components for the design system.
items.summary: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the three new components for the design system.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 14: Putting Open Data to Work for America’s Communities
items.summary: Learn how federal agencies can leverage The Opportunity Project’s adaptable toolkit to engage cross-sector collaborators and rapidly prototype digital products powered by federal open data.

items.title: Plain Language Basics: Online Workshop
items.summary: Take this three-hour online workshop to learn how to write and edit in plain language.

items.title: Analytics Case Study Part 1: Assessment
items.deck: How to assess your analytics strategy to ensure you’re pulling impactful and relevant data
items.summary: In this workshop, we'll address how to assess your web analytics strategy to ensure you're pulling the most impactful and relevant data to enrich your analysis and understanding of your website performance.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - August 2020
items.deck: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the design system and answer your questions.
items.summary: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the design system and answer your questions.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 13: Securing Water for Food’s Crowdsourcing Culture
items.summary: In this webinar, we discuss how to embed crowdsourcing into the culture of a program to the benefit of the project team, and its participants.

items.title: Plain Language Basics: Online Workshop
items.summary: Take this three-hour online workshop to learn how to write and edit in plain language.

items.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Panel Discussion #3: Who’s Next?
items.summary: Panelists will discuss the importance of developing the next generation of women leaders in IT and in the Federal government.

items.title: The Continuous DevOps Dilemma with Andrew Clay Shafer
items.deck: Change is inevitable, but changing deliberately is the key to making the most of our circumstances.
items.summary: Using DevOps to help change entrenched behaviors in organizations.

items.title: 2020 Government UX Summit: July 28, 29, and 30
items.summary: A remote event covering user experience (UX) methods, service design, and managing UX in the government.

items.title: Analytics Lessons From Canada.ca
items.deck: We’ll be talking analytics goals, lessons, barriers, and successes with our neighbors up north.
items.summary: In this session, we’ll be joined by Nicholas Pjontek of Canada.ca. Nick will talk about some of the analytics goals, lessons, barriers, and successes in the government of Canada.

items.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Networking Session #2
items.summary: Participants will have the opportunity to virtually interact with top Federal CIOs, and discuss career development, leadership, and best practices on expanding a professional network.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call: Form Components Update
items.deck: For the July U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, talked about the design system and answered audience questions.
items.summary: For the July 2020 USWDS, Dan Williams, USWDS product lead, led a demonstration of several newly released USWDS components.

items.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Panel Discussion #2: Expanding Our Network
items.summary: Panelists will discuss the importance of expanding our professional network outside of our silos to become stronger leaders.

items.title: A Technical Overview of cloud.gov
items.summary: In this webinar, we will provide a technical overview of cloud.gov including a visual representation of its architecture, marketplace services, content delivery networks, and how to engage with cloud.gov.

items.title: Federal Report Card Update
items.summary: Learn how the Center for Plain Language is approaching the Federal Report Card and what agencies can do to get top grades.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 12: How AFWERX Crowdsources an Innovation Culture
items.summary: The Air Force is catalyzing innovation with a variety of partners.

items.title: Making Remote Work Work for Journey Mapping
items.summary: Join us for a discussion about the value of journey mapping, and how to adapt the mapping process to make the most out of remote collaboration.

items.title: 10x Project Lightning Talks: 2020
items.summary: 10x project teams will demonstrate their work to date and provide brief overviews of each project. We hope that these talks will highlight some of the most interesting work happening in government today and inspire others to submit ideas to 10x.

items.title: Shifting Your Metrics Mindset
items.deck: Learn how to orient your analytics strategy around success metrics.
items.summary: In this session, we’ll discuss the classic suite of “marketing metrics” vs what’s more important to us in government “content-based metrics”.

items.title: Air Force COOL and 18F: Partnership and Flight Operations Software Agile Lessons Learned
items.summary: Highlights from the Air Force Materiel Command & 18F partnership and the importance of organizational structure, roles of the core team, and user outreach for military and government DevOps.

items.title: Short Case Study: A/B Testing for Data-Driven Design
items.summary: See how our Office of Strategic Communication used A/B testing to resolve a difference of opinion within a cross-functional design team.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call: Design Modernization and the Importance of Designers
items.summary: The June 2020 USWDS monthly focused on the design system and design modernization with guest speakers from 18F.  Dan Williams, USWDS product lead, led the call and facilitated a live question and answer session with event attendees.

items.title: 2020 Census Language Support in 59 Non-English Languages
items.summary: How the Census Bureau provided language assistance in 59 non-English languages for the 2020 Census.

items.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Networking Session #1
items.summary: Participants will have the opportunity to virtually interact with top Federal CIOs, and discuss career development, leadership, and best practices on developing a professional network.

items.title: Building for the 21st-Century Web with Federalist
items.summary: Building, deploying, and hosting fast, secure, and compliant federal web sites and applications with Federalist.

items.title: How USAGov en Español Uses Quantitative and Qualitative Data to Meet the Needs of Its Audience
items.summary: In this workshop, we will show how USAGov en Español collects and analyzes data from across several social media channels and the USAGov Contact Center to design and improve content and outreach strategies.

items.title: Women In Federal IT & Cyber Conference Panel #1: Designing a Network
items.deck: Panelists will be discussing the importance of surrounding yourself with those with similar skills, and a strategic professional network.
items.summary: The importance of surrounding yourself with those with similar technical skills, finding your niche, and designing a professional network. The concept of a professional network might be intimidating, why not start with those with similar interests and skills to create a core network. A core network prioritizes those with similar technical skills to build a strong foundation. You can expect to come away with a) the why of designing a core network, b) ways to identify people with similar skills, and c) steps you can take to design a strategic professional network.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 11: Mobile Testing Program Makes Content More Accessible
items.summary: Agencies optimize mobile experiences with help from federal testers.

items.title: Become a DAP Certified Analyst
items.deck: Learn about the Digital Analytics Program (DAP) exam and how you can use it to demonstrate your analytics mastery
items.summary: In this session, we’ll tell you about the Digital Analytics Program’s Certified Analyst exam and how you can use it to demonstrate your analytics mastery!

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - Cards, Forms, and Data Visualizations
items.deck: U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, and team talked about the design system and answered audience questions.
items.summary: The May 2020 USWDS monthly call revisited the design system’s card and forms components. Speakers also paid special attention to data visualization.

items.title: Procuring Cloud Services in Government
items.summary: In this workshop, we will guide agencies through the streamlined Technology Transformation Services cloud acquisition process at the U.S. General Services Administration.

items.title: DevOps Lessons Learned from the Air Force’s Early Cloud Journey
items.summary: Lessons learned in the areas of people, processes, and tools from early efforts in the Air Force’s journey to a multi-cloud environment.

items.title: The Average American Reader Needs You to Write (Even More) Clearly
items.summary: Learn about the skills and needs of American readers, how we are failing our audiences, and ways to do better.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 10: A precisionFDA Strike for Public Health
items.summary: See how the U.S. Food and Drug Administration crowdsources to identify potential health risks.

items.title: You Are a Product Manager (Though You May Not Know It)
items.summary: We will define product management, discuss how it's used in the government context through a case study, and arm listeners with practices to use and evangelize product thinking.

items.title: Dr. Emily Shen on Secure Multi-Party Computation
items.deck: This talk will describe how organizations can collaborate in a privacy-preserving manner using a cryptographic technology called secure multi-party computation.
items.summary: Learn how organizations can securely collaborate using cryptographic technologies.
items.host: Hosted by the Federal Privacy Council

items.title: SocialGov Virtual Spring Session
items.summary: Join SocialGov, the federal government’s social media community of practice, for our virtual Spring Session!

items.title: The Hero's Journey for Re-Skilling Talent (And Other Digital Adventures)
items.summary: For those seeking ways to internally re-skill their workforce for digital transformation, a look at mythology reveals a recurring theme where those answering the call are involved in an iterative  cycle of 'leveling-up', a theme that may help change-agents set conditions for successful retention and growth of organic digital talent.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 9: A Match Made in History
items.summary: History Hub is a crowdsourcing platform that helps the public find historical records.

items.title: An Introduction to the Basics of DAP
items.deck: Learn about the reporting interface, common terminology, and basic reports in Google Analytics
items.summary: New to DAP? No problem. Join us to learn about the reporting interface, common terminology, and basic reports. This 2.5 - 3 hour session is designed for novice users to “get off the ground” with DAP and Google Analytics.

items.title: Cloud.gov for Product Managers
items.summary: In this webinar, we will answer commonly asked questions about cloud.gov and explain how using cloud.gov enables development teams to deploy applications quickly and securely.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - Easing into the Design System
items.deck: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the design system and answer your questions.
items.summary: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the design system and answer your questions.

items.title: The Intersection Between Plain Language and 508 Compliance
items.summary: We’ll discuss how plain language intersects with 508 compliance requirements to make federal electronic documents and information technology accessible to people with disabilities.

items.title: AI Tech Workshop: How to Utilize the Open Source Jupyter Project for your Research
items.summary: We'll show you how easy it can be to wrangle data and engage in technical discussions surrounding data, artificial intelligence, machine-learning models.

items.title: Intro to Cloud Foundry on Cloud.gov
items.deck: A look at the open source cloud application platform behind Cloud.gov
items.summary: In this workshop, we demonstrate the basics of using the Cloud.gov platform as a developer.

items.title: Justifying the Web Analyst's Role in Your Organization
items.deck: How to justify an analysts role on your team and make a business case for this person to leadership.
items.summary: In this workshop, we'll address how to think about justifying an analyst role on your team, and talk about the role's many hats, as well as making the business case to your leadership team.

items.title: Navigating Acquisition and Procurement for Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Data Analytics
items.summary: We will provide guidance on how to manage the process of procuring AI products, services, and technologies, including considerations, pitfalls, and lessons learned.

items.title: Why I Love My Agile Team!
items.summary: Join us as we meet with Land Information New Zealand (LINZ) who is utilizing an agile approach to assist in further updating their topographical information and data.

items.title: Writing for the Accessible Web
items.deck: Learn how to write and design web content that is accessible for everyone.
items.summary: Watch this special presentation featuring 18f Content Strategist, Ryan Johnson, where he discusses how you can effectively write accessible web content.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call - Color Tokens Update
items.deck: Watch U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as he talks and answers questions about the design system.
items.summary: Watch U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as he talks about the design system and answers participant questions.

items.title: Readability Audits of Government Websites with Katherine Spivey
items.summary: In this meeting, we’ll talk about readability audits and formulas and how they work—and don’t work—to improve web content and the users’ experience.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 8: How NASA@WORK Ignites Ideas from Within
items.summary: Learn how NASA’s workforce contributes inspiring ideas as part of internal idea competitions facilitated NASA@WORK program.

items.title: RPA Community of Practice: March All-Hands Meeting
items.deck: Discuss the next steps in accelerating the adoption of RPA in the federal environment.
items.summary: Join the RPA Community of Practice online to discuss the next steps in accelerating the adoption of robotic process automation in the federal environment.
items.host: Robotic Process Automation Community of Practice

items.title: Mitigating Bias While Building Research Practices
items.summary: Learn the methods used by 18F and the State of Vermont as they conducted discovery research to understand and improve the experiences of Vermonters who utilize healthcare and economic assistance programs.

items.title: Survey Translation and the Inclusion of End Users in the Process
items.deck: Experiences from the U.S. Census Bureau
items.summary: This talk will offer insights and tips on how to best design and translate surveys and other government materials aimed at reaching non-English speaking members of the public.

items.title: Making a Mobile-Friendly Website Using the ADAPT Model
items.deck: Learn how to improve the user experience of your website by following the ADAPT Model to enhance the performance of your content on cellular networks or mobile devices.

items.title: Moving From Agile Towards DevOps With a Small Team
items.summary: In this webinar, Chris Lauer will share some of the successes and failures as the Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC) has adopted Agile, and our gradual move towards DevOps.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call: Website Standards Panel Discussion
items.deck: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we talk about the design system and answer your questions.
items.summary: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we discuss the USWDS and answer your questions.

items.title: The YouTube Event Option
items.deck: Learn how to track plays of embedded YouTube videos on your DAP-enabled pages
items.summary: In this session, you’ll learn how to track plays of embedded YouTube videos on your DAP-enabled pages, and how to create reports for analysis.

items.title: Reaching America’s Veterans in the Digital Space
items.summary: In this discussion, we’ll hear from the digital experts at the Department of Veterans Affairs on their successful strategies for reaching America’s veterans through digital platforms.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 7: Crowdsourcing for Code
items.summary: Learn how the Code.gov team, and every day contributors, are helping the U.S. government to expand its repository—and application—of open-source code as part of Code.gov’s Open Tasks initiative.

items.title: How Agencies Are Spreading Best Practices
items.deck: A panel discussion with people from six different agencies on how they share technical best practices in their organizations.
items.summary: Join the DevOps Community of Practice in a panel discussion as different agencies share technical best practices in various offices.

items.title: 10x Project Lightning Talks
items.summary: In this webinar, 10x project teams demonstrate their work to date and provide brief overviews of each project. Topics range from federating data to agile budgeting to machine learning, and our hope is that these talks will inspire others to submit ideas to 10x.

items.title: USWDS Monthly Call: Using the USWDS Maturity Model
items.summary: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we discuss the USWDS maturity model and answer your questions.

items.title: SocialGov Winter Meeting
items.summary: Join us for talks by colleagues from NIST, IRS, USPTO, PlainLanguage.gov, and DC HSEMA who will speak on the latest social media topics and an opportunity to do some in-person networking.

items.title: Plain Language in 2020
items.deck: A look ahead at the coming year, and what we’ll accomplish together
items.summary: A look ahead at the coming year, and what we’ll accomplish together.

items.title: U.S. Web Design System: December Monthly Call
items.summary: Join U.S. Web Design System Product Lead, Dan Williams, as we discuss the USWDS and answer your questions.

items.title: DevOps Holiday Special Event: Nicolas Chaillan
items.summary: Join the Chief Software Officer of the USAF to learn: How the DoD moved to Kubernetes and Istio.

items.title: NIST Director Rob Dimeo: Learning to Communicate Complex Data
items.summary: In this talk, NIST Director Rob Dimeo will explore how sketchnoting can be used to communicate complex data in simple ways - to both internal and external audiences.

items.title: U.S. Web Design System: November Monthly Call
items.summary: Join Dan Williams, U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) product lead, in our monthly call as he walks through the design system and answers your questions.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Site Analysis, Live!
items.summary: Join us for a live demonstration of a real site analysis - from defining website mission, goals, and KPIs, to pulling reporting to better understand site performance.

items.title: SocialGov Talk: Reaching Small Businesses in the Digital Environment
items.summary: In this webinar, the social media experts from the U.S. Small Business Administration discussed how they find and communicate with small businesses on their social media platforms.

items.title: Jez Humble: Building and Scaling High Performing Technology Organizations
items.summary: This talk presents the findings from the latest State of DevOps report, including how to measure the performance of software teams, what capabilities organizations should invest in to drive higher performance, and how software leaders can apply these findings in their own organizations.

items.title: An Introduction to the A/B Testing Community of Practice
items.summary: We know there are many ways to use A/B testing to inform decision making at your agency – this is a quick introduction on the many ways CFPB has used it to improve UX across their website.

items.title: Workforce Modernization Workshop Part 1: Attract and Retain the Best Talent to Better Serve Our Citizens
items.summary: In this workshop, we will answer the question of how to cultivate a workforce that is empowered to be as nimble and sophisticated as the products it procures.

items.title: Intro to Kanban, Part II
items.deck: with Alan Atlas and Alan Brouilette
items.summary: Part two of an introduction to Kanban and how to use it to model any flow-based process.

items.title: Intro to Kanban, Part I
items.deck: with Alan Atlas and Alan Brouilette
items.summary: Part one of an introduction to Kanban and how to use it to model any flow-based process.

items.title: Ginny Redish: How to Collaborate on Strategies
items.summary: How does content strategy mesh with business, user experience (UX), and a marketing strategy?

items.title: Basics of Scrum, Part II
items.deck: with Alan Atlas and Alan Brouilette
items.summary: Scrum is the most widely used Agile software development methodology. This second session will go into more detail about what is happening during each of the Scrum ceremonies.

items.title: The National Language Service Corps Can Fulfill Your Translation Needs
items.summary: An increase in demand for multilingual digital content, shrinking budgets, and rising translation costs have impacted federal agencies trying to offer information and services in languages other than English. Learn how the National Service Language Corps (NLSC) can help.
items.host: Multilingual Community of Practice and Digital.gov

items.title: Basics of Scrum, Part I
items.deck: with Alan Atlas and Alan Brouilette
items.summary: Scrum is the most widely used Agile software development methodology. This session will cover the basics of Scrum at a very high level.

items.title: Happy 3rd Birthday, Code.Gov! What We’ve Learned Three Years In
items.summary: As Code.gov begins our third trip around the sun, we want to take a look at where we’ve been, where we’re going in the world of open source, and the implementation of the federal source code.

items.title: Foundations of Agile, Part II
items.deck: with Alan Atlas and Alan Brouilette
items.summary: Part two of exploring the fundamentals of the Agile methodology will look at the external view of producing customer value and the difficulty of adopting Agile methods.

items.title: Foundations of Agile, Part I
items.deck: with Alan Atlas and Alan Brouilette
items.summary: This is the first of two sessions that will explore the fundamentals of the Agile methodology.

items.title: Political Savvy - Why It’s Important and How to Master It
items.summary: Robert J. Huttenlocker, who currently serves as the Assistant Inspector General for Management at the Office of Inspector General of the U. S. Department of Agriculture, will be discussing the importance of being politically savvy and how to master it.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 6: The FedRAMP Ideation
items.summary: Betsy Steele, of the Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) team, shares how a crowdsourcing initiative invited the larger cybersecurity community to help inform the next iteration of government’s cloud security authorization program.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: A Deep Dive Into Behavior Reports
items.summary: A deep dive into behavior reporting to help DAP users understand how to use it and what are the pitfalls.

items.title: October DevOps Community Meeting
items.summary: An overview of multiple Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools followed by a deep-dive on how to setup a Gitlab Runner to perform GitOps functions including IaC deployments against multiple AWS environments.

items.title: U.S. Web Design System: October Monthly Call
items.summary: Join Dan Williams, U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) product lead, in our monthly call as he walks through the design system and answers your questions.

items.title: SocialGov Fall Meeting - Podcasting!
items.summary: Join the minds behind four top federal podcasts to learn how to create, produce, and promote professional podcasts that engage with audiences.

items.title: Study Design: Developing a Citizen Science Project that Delivers Results
items.summary: Prior to developing a community-based data collection program, it is essential to think through the scientific process and the steps necessary to create a program where the data collected match your monitoring objectives and data use goals.
items.host: Federal Crowdsourcing and Citizen Science Community of Practice

items.title: Using Neural Machine Translation for Multilingual Communication
items.summary: With the sharp improvement in machine translation quality, the variety of government use cases for this technology has evolved.

items.title: SocialGov Talks: Leveraging Pop Culture With Paul Lester of the DOE
items.summary: Learn from a social media expert at Department of Energy how to use pop culture references as a jumping off point to talk about your agency’s work.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: A Deep Dive Into Acquisition Reports
items.summary: In this webinar, we’ll review the acquisition reporting section in-depth, and discuss usefulness of reports and where there may be gaps in data.

items.title: DevOps Community Monthly Meeting: DevOps for the Decennial Census
items.summary: In this month’s Community meeting, we will hear from a Census team that is brand new to DevOps—failing fast and often, but learning lessons as they undergo a cultural transformation.

items.title: U.S. Web Design System: September Monthly Call
items.summary: This month, we’ll take a look at the development process for a USWDS component and demonstrate how we start with a problem and work to a solution that could be shared across other websites.

items.title: How to Navigate the Complex World of Federal Digital Policy
items.summary: Tori Garten will explore the multi-tiered challenge of understanding and governing federal digital policy in a complex and ever-changing digital world.

items.title: Plain Language Summit 2019
items.deck: A day of talks and conversations on how to advance plain language in government communications
items.summary: A day of talks and conversations on how to advance plain language in government communications, hosted by the federal Plain Language community of practice.

items.title: Federal Robotic Process Automation Industry Day
items.summary: Designed to build collaborative public-private partnerships and inform federal employees, this day-long event will feature presentations from industry and government leaders, automation platform providers, automation systems integrators and consultancies, emerging technology experts, and more.
items.host: The IRS Office of the Chief Procurement Officer, GSA Office of the Chief Financial Officer, OPM Office Employee Services/Strategic Workforce Planning, and the Federal RPA Community of Practice

items.title: A Deep Dive Into the Guide to the Paperwork Reduction Act
items.summary: We will hear from the teams behind the PRA Guide and explore why and how it was built, the methods they used, and what the team is doing to ensure a sustainable path for the future.

items.title: DevOps Community of Practice Monthly Meeting
items.summary: In this talk, we will review how Recreation.gov is built and operated to achieve its uptime goal for millions of yearly transactions.

items.title: SocialGov Talks: Tips for LinkedIn Content Strategy, with Matt Ross
items.summary: Matt Ross, of LinkedIn’s Marketing Solutions Government & Advocacy team, will share tips and best practices on how to improve your agency’s use of content to maximize engagement with your core audience.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: A Deep Dive Into Audience Reports
items.summary: Build upon your audience report knowledge and learn how to leverage these reports to better understand your audience.

items.title: U.S. Web Design System: Aug Monthly Call
items.summary: Join Dan Williams, U.S. Web Design System (USWDS) product lead, as he walks through the design system and answers your questions. This month we’ll take a look at bootstrapping USWDS, including how to add USWDS to a project and start designing in minutes.

items.title: Plain Language In-person Training: Writing Principles and Techniques
items.summary: This in-person training for an update on plain writing principles and the Plain Writing Act of 2010 took place at GSA.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 5: By the People
items.summary: The Library of Congress is the largest library in the world. While often referred to as the research arm of Congress, it is hardly limited to lawmakers. It is open to the public who, in fact, are also helping to make their digital collections more accessible and available to all.

items.title: Machine Learning: How Bureau of Labor Statistics Did It
items.summary: The Bureau of Labor Statistics has been on a journey to improve their data reporting, using and iterating on machine learning, from algorithms to deep neural networks with lessons for everyone on this path.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Misunderstood Metrics
items.summary: What are some examples of misunderstood metrics, and how and when should you use them? We’ll talk about these metrics and their potential misinterpretations and pitfalls.

items.title: American Tech Series, Part Two: Advancing User-centric Design in Government
items.summary: In part two of this multi-part YouTube Live series, learn how User-centered design is a practice honed by the American tech industry

items.title: DevOps Community of Practice Monthly Meeting
items.summary: Overview of the HUD Real Estate Assessment Center (REAC) IT team, program, structure, and their shift to DevOps.

items.title: U.S. Web Design System: How to Migrate Your Site to USWDS 2
items.summary: In our July meeting, the USWDS team and special guests walk through migrating sites to USWDS 2 and take any questions you might have.
items.host: U.S. Web Design System, DigitalGov University

items.title: An Introduction to 10x and How to Get Your Idea Funded
items.summary: Learn how you can work with the new investment fund for technology products in the government.

items.title: Sharpen Your Social Skills for Summer
items.deck: Learn how to develop creative content for social media, make your photos stand out, and sharpen your Instagram skills.
items.summary: Learn how to develop creative content for social media, make your photos stand out, and sharpen your Instagram skills.

items.title: Federal Plain Language Report Card Planning
items.summary: Come and help us plan for this year's federal report card review.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 4: Open Opportunities
items.summary: The Open Opportunities program is a “win-win” for federal employees looking to refresh their skills and U.S. agencies seeking talent, energy, and enthusiasm from across a diverse cross-section of the federal workforce.

items.title: Data Storytelling With the Presidential Innovation Fellows
items.summary: A two-hour workshop with Presidential Innovation Fellows to learn how to give your data its best story possible.

items.title: Government API Community of Practice - Quarterly Check-In
items.summary: This afternoon event is an opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest. Remote participants will be able to join in via Google Hangout. Anyone with a federal .gov or .mil address is welcome to attend.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Agency Analytics Governance
items.summary: We’ll talk to members of various agencies to find out how analytics programs and tools are governed at that agency.

items.title: American Tech Series, Part One: Why Leave the Private Sector?
items.summary: In part one of this multi-part YouTube Live series, learn how civic technologists work to better our government.

items.summary: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as we walk through the system’s design tokens and take any questions you might have!
items.host: U.S. Web Design System, DigitalGov University

items.deck: A day focused on designing a better customer experience with and within government
items.summary: A day focused on designing a better customer experience with and within government.

items.title: U.S. Government Open Innovation Summit
items.deck: Transformation Through Citizen Science and Prize Competitions
items.summary: Presentations that highligh the potential and impact of crowdsourcing through citizen science and prize competitions in the U.S. government
items.host: Federal Community of Practice for Crowdsourcing and Citizen Science (FedCCS), Challenges and Prizes Federal Community of Practice

items.title: How to Develop an Agency Brand Voice That Connects With Customers Online
items.summary: Come join the Plain Language community on the 12th of June and learn how to develop an agency brand voice!

items.title: Introduction to Search.gov
items.summary: Come and learn all about Search.gov! The site search for federal government websites

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 3: The Opportunity Project
items.summary: The Opportunity Project engages government, communities, and the technology industry to create digital tools that address our greatest challenges as a nation. Learn how this initiative is making government data more accessible through cross-sector collaboration.

items.title: Executive Core Qualifications (ECQs) – How to Assess, Achieve, and Demonstrate ECQs
items.summary: Come learn all about Executive Core Qualifications.  Cheryl Abram, Lead Evaluation for OPM’s Federal Executive Institute (FEI), will be discussing how to assess, achieve, and demonstrate ECQs.

items.title: Mobile Community of Practice Spring Meeting
items.summary: Join us to learn about the latest developments in the mobile citizen experience. and discuss recent developments and highlight opportunities

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Using the analytics.usa.gov API
items.summary: Learn how Analytics.usa.gov, the public window into how the public interacts with federal government websites, uses an API and allows you to query data in machine-readable formats.

items.title: U.S. Web Design System: May Monthly Call
items.summary: Join the U.S. Web Design System team as we talk through the recent update to 2.0

items.title: 2019 Virtual Student Federal Service (VSFS) Info Session
items.summary: An overview of how your agency can participate in this year’s VSFS program.

items.title: Government UX Summit 2019
items.deck: Methods, Management, and Design
items.summary: Sponsored by the User Experience Community of Practice (UX CoP) and DigitalGov, this event is an opportunity to share experiences and lessons learned in UX and network with other UX practitioners from across the government.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 2: Challenge.gov
items.summary: Need help solving a problem? Join Challenge.gov to learn how federal agencies can use prize competitions to reach innovators in novel ways.

items.title: Innovative Approaches to the Opioid Crisis
items.deck: How Communities Are Crowdsourcing Solutions to Confront This Crisis
items.summary: Join federal, state and local governments and the broader community in an exploration of crowdsourcing approaches to address the opioid crisis.

items.title: Indexing with Search.gov
items.deck: Come take a walk through the Search.gov indexing process from start to finish
items.summary: Come take a walk through the Search.gov indexing process from start to finish.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Using the Advanced Analysis Tool
items.summary: We’ll demo the Advanced Analysis tool and show how you can use it to better understand your data and create drag-and-drop reports!

items.title: Crowdsourcing for Access & Engagement at the Library of Congress
items.summary: Learn how the Library is utilizing user-centered design to invite the public to explore, transcribe, and tag historical materials through a new open source platform.
items.host: Library of Congress Labs & Digitalgov University

items.title: An Introduction to the U.S. Data Federation
items.summary: Find out how the U.S. Data Federation’s work can help you. The team will give an introduction to the problems the U.S. Data Federation seeks to address, describe its approach, and share its vision for the future of the initiative.

items.title: An Introduction to the DHA Usability Lab
items.deck: Overview, Case Studies, and What’s Next
items.summary: Join us for an overview of the DHA Usability Lab, and the resources they provide to improve customer experience.

items.title: Principles of Speaking Plainly
items.summary: This seminar adapts principles of plain language to the context of speaking, covering not only wording but also structure and integration with visual aids.

items.title: Caroline Jarrett on How to Design a Better Form
items.summary: We have a lot of forms in government, and many of them would benefit from better design. In this talk, Caroline Jarrett will explore a curriculum she’s working on about how to design forms.

items.title: Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, Episode 1: Citizen Science
items.summary: This is the first installment of GSA’s Federal Crowdsourcing Webinar Series, where we look at how to use crowdsourcing to reach beyond your walls and source talent and enthusiasm.

items.title: Federal Leadership & Professional Development Seminar Series: Professional Branding
items.summary: Reginald Gant, a human resources specialist for the Office of Learning, Strategy, and Workforce Development at the Social Security Administration, will be discussing what branding is, why it is important, and the 6-step branding process.
items.host: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

items.title: Government API Community of Practice - Quarterly Check-In
items.summary: This afternoon event is an opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Understanding When to Use Sessions vs. Unique Pageviews
items.deck: Understanding When to Use Sessions vs. Unique Pageviews
items.summary: In this webinar, Freddie Blicher, an analyst for the Digial Analytics Program, will discuss how to think about sessions and unique pageviews in reporting and content analysis.

items.title: Managing Your Plain Language Career
items.summary: We'll discuss how to document and publicize your formal and informal plain language work — teaching, training, reviewing, or copyediting.

items.title: Dalia El-Shimy on Mixed Methods Design Research
items.summary: How should designers collect data and how can they use that data to inform their work? Dalia El-Shimy, UX Research Lead at Shopify's Montreal Office, will share how her team uses mixed methods research in support of its design decisions.

items.title: Analyzing Web Metrics for Federal Privacy Professionals
items.summary: For this event, DAP has partnered with the fine folks who run the Federal Privacy Council's Tech Tuesday Series to teach us how to measure, analyze, and improve experiences for users visiting privacy pages on your agency websites.

items.title: Emerging Technology Leadership Series: Laura Manley, Harvard Technology and Public Purpose Project
items.summary: In this next installment of the Emerging Technology Leadership Series we will discuss with Laura Manley, director of Harvard TAPP,  what agencies should know about better understanding and managing potential risks from promising emerging technologies.

items.title: Emerging Technology for Government Services Meeting
items.summary: This is an opportunity to discuss what agencies need to know about current issues in emerging technologies for IT modernization and form consensus on inter-agency collaboration and resource development, and shape initiatives that empower teams across government.

items.title: December PLAIN Meeting and Holiday Gathering
items.summary: Join us for our traditional winter finger-food potluck where we'll discuss the Clarity 2018 conference and plan out our 2019 meetings.

items.title: Responding to the Federal Plain Language Report Card
items.summary: We will discuss the Federal Plain Language Report Card and how to address the issues the report card brings up.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Basics of A/B Testing Part 2
items.summary: We’ve teamed up with our friends at CFPB to bring you a two-part series on A/B Testing.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Basics of A/B Testing Part 1
items.deck: We’ve teamed up with our friends at CFPB to bring you a two-part series on A/B Testing.
items.summary: We’ve teamed up with our friends at CFPB to bring you a two-part series on A/B Testing.

items.title: Government API Community - Quarterly Check-In
items.summary: An opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Creating Goals and Conversions
items.summary: This online event will cover the Goals feature in Google Analytics.

items.title: GSA Future Services Now: Emerging Tech for Government Services
items.summary: A half-day symposium on emerging technologies with leading agencies, industry, and civic collaborators.

items.title: A Conversation with Evan Papp of Power Africa
items.summary: Evan Papp will talk about a video and story he produced while traveling internationally in Africa.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Writing Custom JavaScript for Tag Managers
items.summary: This online event will focus on how to track specific events and write JavaScript to maximize the tag manager experience

items.title: Getting Started with USWDS 2.0
items.summary: The U.S. Web Design System team will show you how to get started with USWDS 2.0: how to set up your project colors, fonts, and more.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: An Introduction to the Basics
items.summary: This online class will provide an introductory training on how to use Digital Analytics Program (DAP) google analytics data.

items.title: Performance Goals for Government Services / August 2018 Inter-agency Emerging Citizen Technology Meeting
items.summary: How agencies can align their emerging technology for government services programs with Cross-Agency Priority Goals (CAP Goals) on Performance.gov and other strategic priorities.

items.title: Emerging Technology Leadership Series: AI for Government Services with Mina Hanna
items.summary: Mina Hanna is the chair of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers’ (IEEE) Artificial Intelligence and Autonomous Systems Policy Committee. He will share what federal managers need to know to understand this increasingly complex and expanding field.

items.title: Civic Service Design Tools + Tactics
items.summary: Join us for this hour long webinar to receive an introduction on the Civic Service Design Tools + Tactics, a set of practical ways to gather insights from the people who depend on your services in their own environments.

items.title: Plain Language Summit 2018
items.summary: The federal Plain Language community is holding their first all-day summit in Washington D.C., and you’re invited!

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Analytics and Accessibility
items.summary: This online event will cover how to check if behaviors change when people are using keystrokes to click, which might give insight into how users with disabilities interact with your site

items.title: Emerging Technology Leadership Series: Brian Behlendorf and Blockchain
items.summary: The Emerging Technology Leadership Series, hosted by the U.S. General Services Administration Emerging Citizen Technology Office, is a six-part livestream pilot to enhance the modern federal workforce with training, education and awareness of emerging technologies including Artificial Intelligence, Robotic Process Automation, Blockchain, Social Technologies and Virtual/Augmented Reality.

items.title: An Inside Look at How the FBI Develops Engaging Video
items.summary: Do you want to learn how to create a successful video strategy from beginning to end?

items.title: Government API Community of Practice - Quarterly Check-In
items.summary: This afternoon event is an opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest. Remote participants will be able to join in via Google Hangout. Anyone with a federal .gov or .mil address is welcome to attend.

items.title: PLAIN Language: Forms-a-palooza
items.summary: Join the the Plain Language Community of Practice for an hour-long conversation about how best to revise forms and convince your agency that the long-term benefits outweigh the cost.

items.title: What You Need to Know: Required Prize Reporting to Congress
items.summary: Federal employees who have been involved in running a prize competition for their agencies at any point during fiscal years 2017 and 2018 should attend this information session on prize reporting.

items.title: A First Look at USWDS 2.0
items.summary: This month, the USWDS team will share what's coming up in version 2.0 which is set to launch later this summer.

items.title: Usability Testing with Steve Krug
items.summary: Join us for a 90-minute demonstration and talk with Steve Krug, where he will share how you can get started making usability fixes, no matter what your full-time job is.

items.title: Funding the Future: Technology Modernization Fund Proposal Workshop
DAP Learning Series: Using the Search Console
items.summary: This online class will dive deeper into the benefits of integrating Google Search Console with your independently managed Google Analytics account

items.title: Free & Open Source Software in Government with Code.mil
items.summary: Join the Code.mil team for a discussion on open source in government and a look at the important work they have been doing on Code.mil to enable greater adoption of open source at the DoD.

items.title: U.S. Web Design System Monthly Call
items.summary: Join us for our monthly conversation with designers and developers across the government.

items.title: How Design Systems Help Us Work Together — with Brad Frost
items.summary: Join Brad Frost as he talks about design systems and the role they play in creating a successful, collaborative structure for modern organizations.

items.title: How Search Engines Index Your Websites
items.summary: Join Search.gov as they walk you through the fundamentals of how search engines monitor your content and pull relevant data from your pages.

items.title: Get to Know the Virtual Student Federal Service
items.summary: Learn how U.S. college students working remotely can be virtual interns for you and your federal government teams through the Virtual Student Federal Service.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Advanced Concepts
items.summary: This half-day online class will expand upon the basics of Google Analytics.

items.title: An Overview of the Technology Modernization Fund (TMF)
items.summary: The Technology Modernization Fund (TMF) Program Management Office and the GSA Emerging Citizen Technology Office (ECTO) are hosting a conversation to help agencies develop proposals for technology modernization projects.
items.host: The GSA Emerging Citizen Technology Office (ECTO)

items.title: Federal Challenge & Prize Community of Practice Quarterly Meeting
items.summary: Crowdsourcing experts from around the federal government come together to discuss trends, success stories and lessons learned in the use of competitions.

items.title: An Introduction to Search.gov
items.summary: Learn about the essential features of Search.gov and tour its Admin Center.

items.title: U.S. Web Design System Monthly Call
items.summary: Join us for our monthly conversation with designers and developers across the government.

items.title: U.S. Government API Community of Practice - Quarterly Check-In
items.summary: This afternoon event is an opportunity for API practitioners from across federal agencies to come together, share news, and discuss topics of interest. Anyone with a federal .gov or .mil address is welcome to attend.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: Creating Your Own Campaign URL Builder
items.summary: This online event will cover how to create a campaign URL in Google Analtyics and how to effectively implement it.

items.title: A Deep Dive Into Top Tasks with Gerry McGovern
items.summary: This talk will focus on how using the top tasks approach will help you deliver what your customers want to make it easier and faster for people to do things they need to do with government.

items.title: Creating Videos in Languages Other Than English
items.summary: Join the Multilingual and Video Production Pros Communities of Practice for a talk about a video the CFPB created, for a Spanish speaking audience.

items.title: Marketing-as-a-Service: An Introduction to USAGov's Partnership Toolkit
items.summary: The USAGov team will talk about their new Partnership Toolkit and focus on how government agencies can partner with USAGov to market various programs and services.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: A Deep Dive into Analytics Events
items.summary: This online event will focus on events in Google Analytics

items.title: Conversations on Public Impact: How data trusts can preserve and protect your digital initiatives
items.summary: The Ethics Working Group in GSA's Technology Transformation Service hosts a presentation about data trusts; a legal structure designed to manage data, code, and other digital assets.

items.title: Video Production Pros Roundtable
items.summary: Join the Video Production Pros Community for our first meeting, to share inspiration, to discuss the future of the community and how you can get involved.

items.title: Infographics: Plain Language Considerations
items.summary: The March meeting of the Plain Language Community of Practice will focus what makes an infographic easy to understand

items.title: Federal Challenge & Prize Community of Practice Quarterly Meeting
items.summary: This quarterly meeting brings together federal employees from a range of agencies to discuss trends, success stories and lessons learned in the use of crowdsourcing competitions.

items.title: DAP Learning Series: An Introduction to the Basics
items.summary: This online class will provide an introductory training on how to use Digital Analytics Program (DAP) google analytics data.

items.title: Plain Language Community Meeting
items.summary: This in-person meeting of the Plain Language Community of Practice will focus on volunteers.

items.title: U.S. Digital Registry Open Office Hours
items.summary: Virtual open office hours to answer your questions about the U.S. Digital Registry.

items.title: Customer Relationship Management - Government Sector Best Practices, Pitfalls and Tips
items.summary: Join the CX Community for their first meeting of 2018 where CRM in government will be discussed.

items.title: U.S. Web Design Standards Monthly Users Call
items.summary: In our next monthly users call, the U.S. Web Design Standards core team will share what they’re working on in 2018.

items.title: How to Better Serve Your LEP Audience by Meeting the Federal Requirements
items.summary: Learn about your legal obligations to limited English proficient individuals (LEP) as a federal, state, or local government agency. We'll provide an overview of national origin discrimination and offer practical tips for overcoming language barriers and language access program planning.

items.title: January PLAIN Monthly Meeting
items.summary: Monthly meeting of the Plain Language Community of Practice.
items.host: Plain Language Action and Information Network

items.title: U.S. Digital Registry Open Office Hours
items.summary: Virtual open office hours to answer your questions about the U.S. Digital Registry

items.title: Responding to a Disaster: How USAGov Helped Shape the Digital Response in Puerto Rico
items.summary: This interactive talk with a USAGov team member will highlight the digital response in Puerto Rico during and after Hurricane Maria.

items.title: Inter-agency Federal Emerging Citizen Technologies Forum
items.summary: First monthly inter-agency form for the Emerging Citizen Technology program.

items.title: Workshop: Making Government Websites with GitHub, Federalist & U.S. Web Design Standards
items.summary: Come learn how to create a simple, compliant government website, using Federalist, GitHub and the U.S. Web Design Standards.

items.title: Connect With Your Spanish-Language Audience on Social Media
items.summary: This event will provide concrete tips and examples of how to reach more Spanish speakers needing and looking for government information through social media

items.title: DAP Learning Series – Visualizing Analytics Data Part 2
items.summary: In this online event, we'll discuss how to use tools that are designed to import data and visualize it without report exports.

items.title: An Around the World Recap PLAIN Monthly Meeting
items.summary: In this online event, PLAIN co-chairs will provide a recap of international plain language initiatives discussed at the 2017 Plain Language Association International conference in Graz, Austria.
